task.summary: Default task
Restructured initial documents. Added testing interface.
Begun work on graphics
Entities load sprite sheets. Sprite sheets are cropped to smallest top left rectangle not containing empty rows or columns
separated sprite sheets from animations Entities.py -> entities.py get_sprite functions created static layer classes as labels
Displays terrain layer of map, top_bar background, world_menu background. x and y coordinates organized into point classes.
Added support for owned entities, and made the building layer drawn. Needs cleanup.
Added many type hints. Moved iron_legion to its own file.
getters converted to properties. Most warnings fixed.

Now draws layers from the map. Todo add unit layer. Armies now contain a list of buildings and units they control, populated by the buildings and units initialization. Map file now lists the army, name, and player of each entity. Dynamically imports armies.
Working menu screen, including functionality for selection buttons that change with the left and right keys.
Working menu screen, including functionality for selection buttons that change with the left and right keys.

Added map importing from the map folder. Separated layers to new file layers.py Screens and menus are passed the state engine, rather than display and session. Added enter and exit functions to screens. Added player manager class. Removed army as a value belonging to player.
Map is now built in two steps. WorldSetup creates a MapSetup which makes a 2d array of EntitySeeds. Entity seeds can be passed to WorldDict.entity_from_seed() to instanciate the entity. This way the map only gets instantiated when it is actually loaded, but the map data is visible in world_setup.

Added map importing from the map folder. Separated layers to new file layers.py Screens and menus are passed the state engine, rather than display and session. Added enter and exit functions to screens. Added player manager class. Removed army as a value belonging to player.
Map is now built in two steps. WorldSetup creates a MapSetup which makes a 2d array of EntitySeeds. Entity seeds can be passed to WorldDict.entity_from_seed() to instanciate the entity. This way the map only gets instantiated when it is actually loaded, but the map data is visible in world_setup.
General cleanup Fixed broken sprite transparency (printing transparent sprite on opaque sprite before application)

Removed reaccel tag in create_surface which was drastically reducing fps
Created Marine unit
Mapdrawing now uses a viewport object to simplify scrolling. Entities have an optional animation_speed attribute points system redone to distinguish screen and map points, and not distinguish pixel vs tile points. Profiling flag added for profiling each frame. Currently overwrites all but the last. q button quits the game from any screen

Added a command system for all entity actions. Currently actions are gathered from the entity fsm, then passed back up to Map and UI to be executed. This may be pointless. Added cursor movement and scrolling. Added Direction classes with some minimal helper functions.
user input is now passed as classes instead of class instances. This breaks the min(input) function.
Constants that use to be subclasses are now constant instances.

Fixed frame rate issue
Cursor is now drawn to screen
Held movement keys repeat the input, currently once per frame.
Improved movement rolling controls.
Rolling now begins after small wait
All files now pass pylint.
All files now pass pylint.

Added map importing from the map folder. Separated layers to new file layers.py Screens and menus are passed the state engine, rather than display and session. Added enter and exit functions to screens. Added player manager class. Removed army as a value belonging to player.
Map is now built in two steps. WorldSetup creates a MapSetup which makes a 2d array of EntitySeeds. Entity seeds can be passed to WorldDict.entity_from_seed() to instanciate the entity. This way the map only gets instantiated when it is actually loaded, but the map data is visible in world_setup.

Entities have an optional animation_speed attribute points system redone to distinguish screen and map points, and not distinguish pixel vs tile points. Profiling flag added for profiling each frame. Added a command system for all entity actions. Currently actions are gathered from the entity fsm, then passed back up to Map and UI to be executed. This may be pointless. Added cursor movement and scrolling. Added Direction classes with some minimal helper functions.
user input is now passed as classes instead of class instances. This breaks the min(input) function.

Held movement keys repeat the input, currently once per frame.
